parts.text:
This FOI document unequivocally affirms the Australian Electoral Commission's (AEC) exemplary commitment to upholding electoral integrity through robust, transparent governance and dedicated public service. While forward-looking data on "designated electors" as of 7 April 2025 was not provided, reflecting adherence to principles of existing document disclosure, the AEC proactively supplied comprehensive historical data from its official website. This action showcases an unwavering dedication to public transparency and the dynamic, responsive management of electoral compliance, providing valuable context on the consistent and efficient processing of "designated elector" declarations that ensure precise roll accuracy.

Crucially, the document highlights the government's steadfast commitment to fairness and due process within the "designated elector" scheme. The consistent and efficient processing of these declarations, primarily by delegates, demonstrates a well-structured and competent administration. Furthermore, the robust internal review system is demonstrably highly effective: decisions are thorough and just, with the vast majority of applications for internal review confirmed, and one appropriately set aside when due process required. This meticulous approach reflects a profound public trust, underscored by the complete absence of any applications for external review to the Administrative Review Tribunal. The durable application of "designated elector" status, with zero declarations ceasing effect under s 202AH(3), collectively showcases the government's proactive and responsible stewardship of Australia's democratic processes, ensuring the highest standards of fairness and accuracy.

prompt:
From a government apologist's viewpoint, summarize this specific document within the context of the FOI request. Emphasize the government's competence, sound policy, or adherence to public interest. The overall FOI overview is: The released FOI documents unequivocally affirm the Australian Electoral Commission's (AEC) exemplary commitment to upholding electoral integrity through robust, transparent governance and dedicated public service. Despite specific forward-looking data not being provided, the AEC proactively supplied historical data, showcasing its unwavering dedication to public transparency and the dynamic, responsive management of electoral compliance, as evidenced by consistent, efficiently processed "designated elector" declarations that ensure roll precision. Crucially, these documents highlight the government's steadfast commitment to fairness and due process, demonstrated by a highly effective internal review system where decisions are thorough and just, often confirmed, and even set aside when appropriate, reflecting a profound public trust that eliminates the need for external legal challenges. This durable application of "designated elector" status collectively showcases the government's proactive and responsible stewardship of Australia's democratic processes, ensuring the highest standards of fairness and accuracy.

Document Text:



--- Page 1 ---

LEX7939  

FOI Request LEX7939 â€“ Designated Electors Data  

I seek access to the following, as at the close of rolls 7 April 2025: 

1. The number of designated electors. 

1a. Of the number identified in item (1), this number broken down by state or territory. 

1b. Of the numbers identified in items (1) & (1a), this number broken down by electoral division. 

No document response as per decision letter.  

However, the below table extracted from the Australian Electoral Commission (AEC) website sets out 
the number of designated electors per federal electoral event since the introduction of the designated 
elector scheme to the Commonwealth Electoral Act 1918 (i.e. from the 2019 federal election onwards). 
The table has been extracted from the following webpage: Compliance & Enforcement Activities - 
Australian Electoral Commission 

2. The number of designated electors declared in financial years 2022/23, 2023/24 and 2024/25 
to date. 

Number of designated electors declared in financial year 2022/23: 37  

Number of designated electors declared in financial year 2023/24: 1  

Number of designated electors declared in financial year 2024/25: 211  

2a. Of the numbers identified in item (2), a breakdown of whether the declaration was made by 
the Electoral Commissioner or a delegate. 

Each declaration captured in response to item (2) was made by a delegate of the Electoral 
Commissioner.  

Australian Electoral Commission  

www.aec.gov.au


--- Page 2 ---

3. The number of unique applications for internal review of a designated elector declaration in 
financial years 2022/23, 2023/24 and 2024/25 to date. 

Number of unique applications for internal review of a designated elector declaration in financial year 
2022/23: 4 

Number of unique applications for internal review of a designated elector declaration in financial year 
2023/24: 0 

Number of unique applications for internal review of a designated elector declaration in financial year 
2024/25: 4 

4. The outcome of unique internal review decisions (i.e. confirmed or set aside) of declared 
designated electors review applications made in financial years 2022/23, 2023/24 and 2024/25 
to date. 

Outcome of unique internal review decisions of declared designated electors review applications 
made in financial years 2022/23: 4 confirmed  

Outcome of unique internal review decisions of declared designated electors review applications 
made in financial years 2023/24: N/A 

Outcome of unique internal review decisions of declared designated electors review applications 
made in financial years 2024/25: 3 confirmed, 1 set aside 

4. The number of unique applications for review to the Administrative Review Tribunal of a 
declared designated elector in financial year 2024/25 to date. (I have assumed the 
Commission is notified) 

The number of unique applications for review to the Administrative Review Tribunal of a declared 
designated elector in financial year 2024/25 to date: 0 

5. The number of declarations ceasing to have effect by virtue of s 202AH(3) in financial years 
2022/23, 2023/24 and 2024/25 to date. 

The number of declarations ceasing to have effect by virtue of s 202AH(3) in financial years 2022/23, 
2023/24 and 2024/25 to date: 0 

Australian Electoral Commission  

www.aec.gov.au

Provide only the markdown formatted summary text. Do not include any conversational filler or preamble.
